subject: Public Speaking
title: The Anchoring Trap in Arguments
description: A quick win: understand The Anchoring Trap in Arguments.

hook.text: A lawyer asks for ten million dollars in damages. The jury awards one million and thinks they were reasonable.

buildup.text: Anchoring is when the first number you hear distorts your judgment of every number that follows.

discovery.text: Even when people know the anchor is arbitrary, it still pulls their estimate toward it. The bias is nearly unbeatable.

twist.text: Speakers use anchors strategically. Start with a dramatic statistic and every later number is judged relative to it.

climax.text: Anchoring works because the brain needs a reference point. If you don't provide one, someone else will.

punchline.text: The first number wins. Make sure it's yours.

quiz.question: What is anchoring in persuasion?
options: The first number you hear distorts judgment of all later numbers
